title: Zero to ICP
body: This foundational course introduces newcomers to the basics of the Internet Computer Protocol (ICP). Participants will learn how to set up their development environment, understand the core concepts of the protocol, and prepare for more advanced study in ICP technologies.

title: ICP Zero to Dapp
body: Dive into decentralized application (Dapp) development on the Internet Computer in this practical course. You will learn to build and deploy your own Dapps, utilizing ICP's seamless integration capabilities and decentralized infrastructure.

title: TypeScript on ICP
body: In this beginner course on Decade, you will learn essential Internet Computer concepts and how to write canister smart contracts using TypeScript.
topics: motoko language, boundary nodes, consensus, message routing, execution, chainkey, bitcoin integration, tokenomics, nns, sns, canisters, internet identity
azle language, canisters, candid ui, stable structures, setup, rust

title: ICP Rust Bootcamp
body: From core concepts, to the ICP EVM model, to hands-on experience with Rust using the Remix IDE, this Rise In bootcamp will open your eyes to the potential of Web3 development.
topics: icp, icp overview, canisters, management canister, nodes, inter canister calls, subnets, chainkey, nns
icp, rust, smart contract, environment setup
rust, state management, stable structures, stable memory
state management, rust, stable memory, stable structures

title: ICP Developer I (ES)
body: A 4-week basics course in Spanish that covers canister development using Motoko, creating a backend and frontend canister, and ending with building your own dapp on the Internet Computer.

title: ICP Developer II (ES)
body: The purpose of this ICP Developer II is for you to continue developing the Canister frontend of your project and finish this week with your first DApp running 100% on-chain on the Internet Computer network

title: Rust Smart Contract 101
body: This course provides an in-depth introduction to developing smart contracts using Rust on the Internet Computer. It focuses on the key aspects of Rust programming, smart contract security, and the deployment of contracts on the ICP network.
topics: azle language, canisters, candid ui, stable structures, setup, rust

title: Community Conversations
body: Engage with the vibrant Internet Computer community in this interactive course. It features live discussions, Q&A sessions with experienced developers, and insights into the latest ICP developments and community projects.

title: Motoko Bootcamp
body: Master the Internet Computerâ€™s native language, Motoko, in this comprehensive bootcamp. From basic syntax to advanced features, this course covers all you need to start building powerful and efficient smart contracts on ICP.
topics: query calls, update calls, cycles, motoko language, wasm, canisters, actor model
icp, cycles, canisters, wasm, http gateway, subnets, chainkey, icp overview
motoko language, wasm, candid ui, canisters, inter canister calls

title: ICP 101
body: An introductory course that covers the essentials of the Internet Computer and its revolutionary approach to blockchain technology. Learn about the architecture, consensus mechanism, and the overall ecosystem of the ICP.

title: TypeScript Bootcamp
body: Web3 with TypeScript Bootcamp powered by Code & State and get started in Web3 in one week
topics: azle language, stable memory, stable structures
asset canister, http gateway, boundary nodes, service worker, internet identity
azle language, inter canister calls, cycles, timers
azle language, bitcoin integration, chainkey, threshold ecdsa, ckbtc

title: Inside the Internet Computer
body: This course offers a deep dive into the technical underpinnings and innovative features of the Internet Computer. Explore its unique node structure, governance model, and the science behind its high-speed transaction capabilities.

title: ICP Explained
body: Gain a clear understanding of the Internet Computer and its position within the broader blockchain landscape. This course breaks down complex topics into understandable segments, perfect for those new to blockchain technologies.
topics: icp, execution, canisters, query calls, update calls, inter canister calls, chainkey, management canister
icp, asset canister, certification, http gateway

title: ICP Documentation
body: Learn how to navigate and utilize the extensive documentation available for the Internet Computer. This course helps developers find the resources they need to build, deploy, and maintain applications on the ICP.
topics: cycles, cycles wallet, cycles faucet, cycles management

title: Internet Computer Education
body: The Internet Computer reinvents the internet as a global computer that hosts open internet services & secure software. New open-source materials every month.
topics: query calls, update calls, http gateway, access control, inter canister calls, autonomous canisters, motoko language

title: Resource
body: This course serves as a comprehensive guide to the various resources available for Internet Computer developers. Discover tools, community forums, and expert tips to enhance your development skills and knowledge.
topics: motoko language, candid, tooling, stable memory, dao, authentication, testing, icp overview, chainkey, vetkeys, cycles management
motoko language, candid, tooling, stable memory, dao, authentication, rust, testing, icp overview, chainkey, vetkeys, cycles management
http outcalls, ethereum, stable memory, chainkey

title: mmapped
body: Explore the innovative 'mmapped' technology on the Internet Computer in this specialized course. Understand how memory-mapped files can be used to enhance the performance and scalability of your decentralized applications.

title: The Azle Book
body: This book is intended to be an in-depth guide to canister development in TypeScript on the Internet Computer (IC).
topics: canisters, query calls, update calls, azle language
stable structures, stable memory, azle language
